author: Suvojit Bagchi
text:
While the Left Front and the Congress are yet to enter into an official alliance, they have struck “a deal,” senior leaders of the West Bengal Congress told The Hindu .

The “deal” is to refrain from putting up candidates in the seats where the Left Front would be contesting. Similarly, the Front would not nominate candidates in the constituencies where the Congress would be challenging the ruling Trinamool Congress. Party general secretary Omprakash Mishra said the “deal is final.”

“We shall contest on seat-sharing basis. We shall not put up candidates in the seats agreed [mutually] to be contested by the Left Front and similarly they [Left] will not put up candidates in the constituencies agreed to be contested by us [the Congress],” Mr. Mishra said.

Both parties to work together

to defeat the

ruling Trinamool Congress
title: Left, Cong. not to field candidates against each other
